sense.name: settle or decide an outcome (A resolves B)
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] RESOLVE NP2 NP1[agent] RESOLVE SCOMP Note: implies the change of a pre-existing state
sense.examples: The judge resolved the case in favor of the plaintiff. She was asked to resolve the quarrel between her siblings. The storm resolved the issue of where to hold the wedding ceremony.

sense.name: solve, find the answer to a problem or question (A resolves the answer to B)
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[animate]] RESOLVE NP2[abstract] NP1[agent[animate]] RESOLVE SCOMP Note: implies NP2 has a specific value that can be known to NP1
sense.examples: Thus far, archeologists have not resolved the meaning of those symbols. Until he can resolve the difference between his equations and those observations, the theory is not supported. Who can resolve what happened before the Big Bang?

sense.name: promise an action; make a resolution
sense.examples: I'll never resolve to give up coffee. The company has resolved to increase health insurance for its employees. He resolved to continue his father's mission. Nine years ago on New Year's Eve, I resolved to drink more.

sense.name: make physically visible, clarify
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] RESOLVE NP2[patient[concrete]] (PP{P NP[instrument]})
sense.examples: Can they resolve these images of Mars more clearly? I couldn't resolve her voice in the din of the loud bar.

sense.name: break up physically, dissolve
sense.examples: The stirring will resolve the clumps of sugar in the water.
